name: Movie Quotes: The 90s, Part 1 Quiz | Which Movie - Very Difficult | 15 Questions

questions.text: 'He's a disco-dancin', Oscar Wilde-readin', Streisand ticket-holdin' friend of Dorothy!'
questions.explanation:
Clueless.

	Murray (Donald Faison) reveals to Cher (Alicia Silverstone) and Dionne (Stacey Dash) that the new student at school who is the object of Cher's infatuation is also, in fact, a homosexual.

questions.text: 'You think I tell the guys in here I got a brother at Harvard?'
questions.explanation:
The Firm.

	Convict Ray McDeere (David Strathairn) tells his brother Mitch (Tom Cruise) not to feel too bad about not telling his colleagues in the legal profession that he has a brother in prison.

questions.text: 'I'm not afraid of the man who wants ten nuclear warheads, Colonel. I'm terrified of the man who only wants one.'
questions.explanation:
The Peacemaker.

	Dr. Julia Kelly (Nicole Kidman) explains to Colonel Tom DeVoe (George Clooney) why she's so distressed about the fact that exactly one nuclear warhead has turned up missing in the seemingly-aborted hijack of a cache containing a number of warheads.

questions.text: 'Mom...I find it amusing that you refer to the 'Weekly World News' as 'the paper'.'
questions.correct: So I Married an Axe Murderer
questions.explanation:
So I Married an Axe Murderer.

	Charlie Mackenzie (Mike Myers) gently ridicules his mother (Brenda Fricker) for her love of tabloids.

questions.text: 'Do you really believe that there's some sort of built-up, unresolved tension between us? There is no 'us'. 'We' don't exist.'
questions.explanation:
Grosse Pointe Blank.

	Martin Blank (John Cusack) defuses a potentially violent incident with Bob (Michael Cudlitz) at their high school reunion.

questions.text: 'The other night I ordered spaghetti with marinara sauce. I got noodles with ketchup.'
questions.correct: Goodfellas & Good fellas & Good-fellas & Goodfellows & Good-fellows & Good Fellows
questions.explanation:
Goodfellas & Good fellas & Good-fellas & Goodfellows & Good-fellows & Good Fellows.

	Henry Hill (Ray Liotta) laments the downside of his new life in the federal witness relocation program.

questions.text: 'Ernest Hemingway once wrote: 'The world is a fine place, and worth fighting for.' I agree with the second part.'
questions.explanation:
Se7en.

	The last words of the film, spoken by Detective William Somerset (Morgan Freeman).

questions.text: 'They'd have killed you already, but you've got a lot of light on you.'
questions.correct: JFK & J.F.K. & J-F-K & J.F.K & J F K
questions.explanation:
JFK & J.F.K. & J-F-K & J.F.K & J F K

	'General X' (Donald Sutherland) explains to Jim Garrison (Kevin Costner) just how dangerous his investigation is.

questions.text: 'Let me get this straight -- you don't want to cheat on your girlfriend with your wife? Jesus, Francis, are you sure I'm your father? I'm gonna have to check with your mother on this.'
questions.explanation:
She's the One.

	The patriarch of the Fitzpatrick family (John Mahoney) expresses both disbelief and disgust upon hearing the unusual confession of his adulterous younger son Francis (Mike McGlone).

questions.text: 'Rule number three: don't you ever try and run on us. 'Cause I've got six little friends...and they can all run faster than you can.'
questions.explanation:
From Dusk Till Dawn.

	Seth Gecko (George Clooney), brandishing his six-shooter, makes it clear to his hostage that any attempt to flee would be a bad idea.

questions.text: 'I was their number one son...and they treated me like number two.'
questions.explanation:
Batman Returns.

	The Penguin, a.k.a. Oswald Cobblepot (Danny DeVito), explains to the citizens of Gotham City that his parents coldly rejected him when he was an infant.

questions.text: 'Man, he must'a thought it was White Boy Day. It ain't White Boy Day, is it?'
questions.explanation:
True Romance.

	Pimp/drug dealer Drexl Spivey (Gary Oldman) wonders aloud why the momentarily-subdued Clarence Worley (Christian Slater) thought that he could make it out of Drexl's stronghold alive. Clarence does manage to get the upper hand, though, so maybe Drexl should have considered his words more carefully.

questions.text: 'Two things I know to be true: there's no difference between good flan and bad flan...and there is no war. Guess who I am.'
questions.explanation:
Wag the Dog.

	CIA Director Young (William H. Macy) makes it clear to Conrad Brean (Robert De Niro) and Winifred Ames (Anne Heche) that he is well aware of the fictional 'war' that they have constructed for the American news media in order to draw attention away from a rather lurid scandal in the White House.

questions.text: 'Don't you people from the future ever pee?'
questions.explanation:
Star Trek: First Contact.

	Twenty-second century warp drive inventor Zephram Cochrane (James Cromwell) finds it odd that 24th-century Starfleet officer Geordi LaForge (Levar Burton) has no idea what Cochrane means when he states that he has to 'take a leak'.

questions.text: 'My wife used to say I was a hard man to know.'
questions.explanation:
The Shawshank Redemption.

	Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) shares some personal information with Red (Morgan Freeman) late in the film.
